The engineered Nbs showed significant cross-reactivity with influenza haemagglutinins.
The engineered Nbs lost specificity to SARS-CoV-2 and bound to multiple viral proteins.
The engineered Nbs were unable to bind to any SARS-CoV-2 RBDs effectively.

HDOCK was chosen because it was the fastest program to run simulations.
HDOCK was selected because it was the only program capable of handling large protein complexes.
HDOCK was chosen due to its ability to predict the physicochemical properties of nanobodies.
